intro: Phyllanthus atabapoensis, commonly known as the Atabapo gooseberry, is a shrub native to the Amazon rainforest of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green leaves and clustered flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or wetland areas. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
